snippet: In denying the request for a preliminary injunction, Judge Naomi Reice Buchwald said the health risks of a religious ceremony involving oral contact with blood were clear.
abstract: Federal Judge Naomi Reice Buchwald rules that New York City health officials may proceed temporarily with plan to require parental consent before an infant may undergo particular Jewish circumcision ritual that poses risk of herpes transmission.
lead_paragraph: In denying the request for a preliminary injunction, Judge Naomi Reice Buchwald said the health risks of a religious ceremony involving oral contact with blood were clear.

headline.seo: Parental Consent Rule May Proceed for a Circumcision Ritual, a Judge Says
headline.main: Consent Rule May Proceed for a Circumcision Ritual
headline.print_headline: Consent Rule May Proceed For a Circumcision Ritual
